title: Example Workflow
Example Workflow
text: Public data access, credentials needed.

title: Example Workflow
text: Username password required.
code: # Connect to Oracle via AKFIN database (default)   channel <- crabpack::get_connected()  # Connect to Oracle via AFSC database (NOAA AFSC users only)   channel <- crabpack::get_connected(db = "AFSC")

what: Connect via Kodiak AFSC network drives
title: Example Workflow
text: VPN connection required.
code: # Set local Kodiak server access (Kodiak Fisheries Research Center users only)   channel <- "KOD"

title: Example Workflow
code: species <- "RKC" specimen_data <- crabpack::get_specimen_data(species = species,                                              region = "EBS",                                              years = c(1975:2024),                                              channel = channel)

what: Calculate time series of district-level biomass and abundance
title: Example Workflow
text: See ?crabpack::calc_bioabund details argumentsNote: example, please verify appropriate species data loaded Example 1: Mature female Bristol Bay Red King Crab using ADF&G cutlines Example 2: Male St. Matthew district Blue King Crab 105 199mm Example 3: Legal-sized male Tanner Crab E166 W166 districts Example 4: Large, new hardshell male EBS Snow Crab 1mm bins 2000-2024
code: matfem_bbrkc <- crabpack::calc_bioabund(crab_data = specimen_data,                                         species = "RKC",                                         region = "EBS",                                         district = "BB",                                         crab_category = "mature_female",                                         female_maturity = "cutline") smbkc_105TO119 <- crabpack::calc_bioabund(crab_data = specimen_data,                                           species = "BKC",                                           region = "EBS",                                           district = "STMATT",                                           sex = "male",                                           size_min = 105,                                           size_max = 119) legal_tanner <- crabpack::calc_bioabund(crab_data = specimen_data,                                         species = "TANNER",                                         region = "EBS",                                         district = "ALL",                                         crab_category = "legal_male") lg_sc2_snow <- crabpack::calc_bioabund(crab_data = specimen_data,                                        species = "SNOW",                                        region = "EBS",                                        years = c(2000, 2024),                                        sex = "male",                                        size_min = 95,                                        shell_condition = "new_hardshell",                                        bin_1mm = TRUE)

what: Calculate time series of station-level CPUE
title: Example Workflow
text: See ?crabpack::calc_cpue details arguments Example 1: 2024 EBS Red King Crab size-sex-maturity category
code: cpue <- crabpack::calc_cpue(crab_data = specimen_data,                             species = "RKC",                             region = "EBS",                             district = "ALL",                             years = 2024,                             crab_category = "all_categories")

what: Pull data on Chionoecetes spp. male morphometric maturity estimation
title: Example Workflow
code: male_maturity_data <- crabpack::get_male_maturity(species = "TANNER",                                                   region = "EBS",                                                   district = "E166",                                                   channel = channel)    # Unpack df: proportion of morphometrically mature male crabs by size      proportion_mature <- male_maturity_data$male_mat_ratio      # Unpack df: model parameter estimates of 50% probability of maturity at size     matmodel_params <- male_maturity_data$model_parameters

what: Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass
title: Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass
text: R package generates standard design-based indices catch per unit effort, abundance, biomass NOAA Alaska Fisheries Science Center RACE Eastern Bering Sea Shelf (1975) Northern Bering Sea Shelf (2010) bottom trawl survey data. package documentation still development, please submit issue come across bug.

title: Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass
Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass
text: legal restrictions access data. reside public domain can freely distributed. User Constraints: Users must read fully comprehend metadata prior use. Data used beyond limits source scale. Acknowledgement AFSC Shellfish Assessment Program, source data obtained, publications /representations data, suggested. General questions specific data requests can sent shannon.hennessey@noaa.gov. version data used stock assessments can found Alaska Fisheries Information Network (AKFIN).

title: Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass

what: Calculate index of station-, district-, or region-level abundance and biomass — calc_bioabund
title: Calculate index of station-, district-, or region-level abundance and biomass — calc_bioabund
text: function calculates indices abundance biomass (mt lbs) station-, district-, region-level given crab species. Optional arguments also allow indices calculated subsets crab biometric categories size, sex, maturity, shell condition.

title: Calculate index of station-, district-, or region-level abundance and biomass — calc_bioabund
code: calc_bioabund(   crab_data = NULL,   species = NULL,   region = c("EBS", "NBS")[1],   district = c("ALL", "BB", "NORTH", "NS", "PRIB", "STMATT", "UNSTRAT", "E166", "W166",     "166TO173")[1],   years = NULL,   sex = NULL,   size_min = NULL,   size_max = NULL,   crab_category = NULL,   female_maturity = c("morphometric", "cutline")[1],   shell_condition = NULL,   egg_condition = NULL,   clutch_size = NULL,   bin_1mm = FALSE,   spatial_level = c("stratum", "district", "region")[2],   replace_retow = TRUE,   rm_corners = FALSE )

title: Calculate index of station-, district-, or region-level abundance and biomass — calc_bioabund
text: crab_data Object created crabpack::get_specimen_data(). species Character string. One c("RKC", "BKC", "TANNER", "SNOW", "HYBRID", "HAIR"). region Character string describing region interest. One c("EBS", "NBS"). Defaults "EBS" Eastern Bering Sea. district Character string. One many c("", "BB", "NORTH", "NS", "PRIB", "STMATT", "UNSTRAT", "E166", "W166", "166TO173"). Defaults "" districts within selected region specified. years Numeric integer vector years. Default output available years data. sex Character string. One c("male", "female"). Optional, "male" "female" provide estimates selected sex, specifying "male" "female" provide estimates selected sexes. size_min Integer. Optional, desired lower range crab size (inclusive). size_max Integer. Optional, desired upper range crab size (inclusive). crab_category Character string. One many c("mature_male", "large_male", "legal_male", "preferred_male", "immature_male", "small_male", "sublegal_male", "mature_female", "immature_female", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected categories; "all_categories" provide estimates relevant category given species. using female category, maturity based morphometric maturity (default female_maturity = "morphometric"). Set female_maturity = "cutline" want define female maturity based ADF&G size cutlines. See crabpack::set_crab_category() documentation description species-specific category combinations. female_maturity Character string. One c("morphometric", "cutline"). Defaults "morphometric" maturity female crab. Morphometric maturity biomass abundance estimates available male crab time. shell_condition Character string. One many c("soft_molting", "new_hardshell", "oldshell", "very_oldshell", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected shell conditions; "all_categories" provide estimates available shell condition category. egg_condition Character string. One many c("none", "uneyed", "eyed", "dead", "empty_cases", "hatching", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected egg conditions; "all_categories" provide estimates available egg condition category. Note specifying egg_condition return female specimens final output. clutch_size Character string. One many c("immature", "mature_barren", "trace", "quarter", "half", "three_quarter", "full", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected clutch sizes; "all_categories" provide estimates available clutch size category. Note specifying clutch_size return female specimens final output. bin_1mm Boolean T/F. TRUE, estimates provided 1mm bin within size range specified size_min /size_max, full range observed sizes data. Defaults FALSE. spatial_level Character string. One c("stratum", "district", "region"). Describes spatial resolution biomass abundance output, aggregated stratum, district (default), regional scale. replace_retow Boolean T/F. TRUE, replace female Bristol Bay red king crab observations resampled data (haul type = 17) years Bristol Bay retow took place. Defaults TRUE, please use care interpreting BBRKC outputs using FALSE. rm_corners Boolean T/F. TRUE, remove corner stations Pribilof St. Matthew Districts calculate CPUE, abundance, biomass based single stratum within surrounding district. Defaults FALSE, used design-based data exercises .

title: Calculate index of station-, district-, or region-level abundance and biomass — calc_bioabund
text: data frame area swept-expanded estimates stratum-, district-, region-level abundance, biomass (mt), biomass (lbs) year.

what: Calculate haul-level catch per unit effort — calc_cpue
title: Calculate haul-level catch per unit effort — calc_cpue
text: function calculates zero-fills weight (mt, lbs) numerical catch per unit effort (area swept, nm2).

title: Calculate haul-level catch per unit effort — calc_cpue
code: calc_cpue(   crab_data = NULL,   species = NULL,   region = c("EBS", "NBS")[1],   district = c("ALL", "BB", "NORTH", "NS", "PRIB", "STMATT", "UNSTRAT", "E166", "W166",     "166TO173")[1],   years = NULL,   sex = NULL,   size_min = NULL,   size_max = NULL,   crab_category = NULL,   female_maturity = c("morphometric", "cutline")[1],   shell_condition = NULL,   egg_condition = NULL,   clutch_size = NULL,   bin_1mm = FALSE,   replace_retow = TRUE,   rm_corners = FALSE,   output = c("cpue", "bioabund")[1] )

title: Calculate haul-level catch per unit effort — calc_cpue
text: crab_data Object created crabpack::get_specimen_data(). species Character string. One c("RKC", "BKC", "TANNER", "SNOW", "HYBRID", "HAIR"). region Character string describing region interest. One c("EBS", "NBS"). Defaults "EBS" Eastern Bering Sea. district Character string. One many c("", "BB", "NORTH", "NS", "PRIB", "STMATT", "UNSTRAT", "E166", "W166", "166TO173"). Defaults "" districts within selected region specified. years Numeric integer vector years. Default output available years data. sex Character string. One c("male", "female"). Optional, "male" "female" provide estimates selected sex, specifying "male" "female" provide estimates selected sexes. size_min Integer. Optional, desired lower range crab size (inclusive). size_max Integer. Optional, desired upper range crab size (inclusive). crab_category Character string. One many c("mature_male", "large_male", "legal_male", "preferred_male", "immature_male", "small_male", "sublegal_male", "mature_female", "immature_female", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected categories; "all_categories" provide estimates relevant category given species. using female category, maturity based morphometric maturity (default female_maturity = "morphometric"). Set female_maturity = "cutline" want define female maturity based ADF&G size cutlines. See crabpack::set_crab_category() documentation description species-specific category combinations. female_maturity Character string. One c("morphometric", "cutline"). Defaults "morphometric" maturity female crab. Morphometric maturity CPUE estimates available male crab time. shell_condition Character string. One many c("soft_molting", "new_hardshell", "oldshell", "very_oldshell", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected shell conditions; "all_categories" provide estimates available shell condition category. egg_condition Character string. One many c("none", "uneyed", "eyed", "dead", "empty_cases", "hatching", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected egg conditions; "all_categories" provide estimates available egg condition category. Note specifying egg_condition return female specimens final output. clutch_size Character string. One many c("immature", "mature_barren", "trace", "quarter", "half", "three_quarter", "full", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected clutch sizes; "all_categories" provide estimates available clutch size category. Note specifying clutch_size return female specimens final output. bin_1mm Boolean T/F. TRUE, estimates provided 1mm bin within size range specified size_min /size_max, full range observed sizes data. Defaults FALSE. replace_retow Boolean T/F. TRUE, replace female Bristol Bay red king crab observations resampled data (haul type = 17) years Bristol Bay retow took place. Defaults TRUE, please use care interpreting BBRKC outputs using FALSE. rm_corners Boolean T/F. TRUE, remove corner stations Pribilof St. Matthew Districts calculate CPUE, abundance, biomass based single stratum within surrounding district. Defaults FALSE, used design-based data exercises . output Character string. One c("cpue", "bioabund"). Default output "cpue"; "bioabund" used internal package purposes .

title: Calculate haul-level catch per unit effort — calc_cpue
text: data frame station-level crab counts, area swept-expanded estimates weight (mt, lbs) numerical CPUE year.

what: crabpack: Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass — crabpack-package
title: crabpack: Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass — crabpack-package
text: package contains functions calculate standard NOAA AFSC Shellfish Assessment Program summer bottom trawl survey data products (CPUE, Abundance, Biomass) Eastern Bering Sea Shelf (1975-present) Northern Bering Sea Shelf (2010-present).

title: crabpack: Calculate Bering Sea Crab CPUE, Abundance, and Biomass — crabpack-package
text: Maintainer: Shannon Hennessey shannon.hennessey@noaa.gov

what: Define DBI odbc connection to Oracle — get_connected
title: Define DBI odbc connection to Oracle — get_connected
text: Creates odbc connection Oracle needed pull SQL queries AKFIN database. Also support users use R package keyring store usernames passwords.

title: Define DBI odbc connection to Oracle — get_connected
Define DBI odbc connection to Oracle — get_connected
text: db String. registered data source name, case "AKFIN" default. argument passed drv argument DBI::dbConnect(). check_access Boolean. TRUE (default), checks whether specific tables AKFIN used crabpack package. Outputs error user access tables message point contact information access.

title: Define DBI odbc connection to Oracle — get_connected
text: Channel class "Oracle". See ?DBI::dbConnect() detail.

what: Pull proportion morphometrically mature Chionoecetes spp. males by size — get_male_maturity
title: Pull proportion morphometrically mature Chionoecetes spp. males by size — get_male_maturity
text: time series model estimated proportion morphometrically mature male Tanner Crab Snow Crab 10 millimeter size bin given region district, based chela height measurements. Yearly model parameter estimates 50% probability maturity size also provided.

title: Pull proportion morphometrically mature Chionoecetes spp. males by size — get_male_maturity
code: get_male_maturity(   species = NULL,   region = c("EBS", "NBS")[1],   district = NULL,   channel = NULL )

title: Pull proportion morphometrically mature Chionoecetes spp. males by size — get_male_maturity
text: species Character string. One c("TANNER", "SNOW"). region Character string describing region interest. One c("EBS", "NBS"). Defaults "EBS" Eastern Bering Sea. district Character string. One many c("", "E166", "W166"). Defaults ""; "E166" "W166" used Tanner Crab . channel Character string Oracle connection. Defaults API connection, (channel = "API"), allowing public data access. use Oracle database connection, set channel object created via crabpack::get_connected() DBI::dbConnect(). Local AFSC Kodiak users can also set channel = "KOD" access data network drives (requires VPN connection). option pull available years districts given species region.

title: Pull proportion morphometrically mature Chionoecetes spp. males by size — get_male_maturity
text: named list containing proportion male Chionoecetes spp. crab morphometrically mature given 10mm size bin, yearly model parameter estimates 50% probability maturity size species, region, district interest.

what: Pull AFSC Shellfish Assessment Program Bering Sea survey data — get_specimen_data
title: Pull AFSC Shellfish Assessment Program Bering Sea survey data — get_specimen_data
text: Pulls haul, specimen, stratum grouping information region, districts, years, species interest CRABBASE schema AKFIN Oracle database.

title: Pull AFSC Shellfish Assessment Program Bering Sea survey data — get_specimen_data
code: get_specimen_data(   species = NULL,   region = c("EBS", "NBS")[1],   district = NULL,   years = NULL,   channel = NULL )

title: Pull AFSC Shellfish Assessment Program Bering Sea survey data — get_specimen_data
text: species Character string. One c("RKC", "BKC", "TANNER", "SNOW", "HYBRID", "HAIR"). region Character string describing region interest. One c("EBS", "NBS"). Defaults "EBS" Eastern Bering Sea. district Character string. One many c("", "BB", "NORTH", "NS", "PRIB", "STMATT", "UNSTRAT", "E166", "W166", "166TO173"). Defaults "" districts within selected region specified. years Numeric integer vector years. Default output available years data. channel Character string Oracle connection. Defaults API connection, (channel = "API"), allowing public data access. use Oracle database connection, set channel object created via crabpack::get_connected() DBI::dbConnect(). Local AFSC Kodiak users can also set channel = "KOD" access data network drives (requires VPN connection). option pull available years districts given species region.

title: Pull AFSC Shellfish Assessment Program Bering Sea survey data — get_specimen_data
text: named list containing specimen, haul, stratum, area, size group information region, districts, years, species interest.

what: Assign size-sex-maturity categories based on species- and district-specific size definitions — set_crab_category
title: Assign size-sex-maturity categories based on species- and district-specific size definitions — set_crab_category
text: utility function assign standard size-sex-maturity categories crab specimen data. Standard categories Red King Crab Blue King Crab immature_male, mature_male, legal_male, immature_female, mature_female. Categories Tanner Crab, Snow Crab, Hybrid Crab small_male, large_male, legal_male, preferred_male, immature_female, mature_female. Categories Hair Crab sublegal_male, legal_male, female.

title: Assign size-sex-maturity categories based on species- and district-specific size definitions — set_crab_category
code: set_crab_category(   crab_data = NULL,   species = NULL,   region = c("EBS", "NBS")[1],   district = NULL,   crab_category = NULL,   female_maturity = c("morphometric", "cutline")[1] )

title: Assign size-sex-maturity categories based on species- and district-specific size definitions — set_crab_category
text: crab_data Object created crabpack::get_specimen_data(). species Character string. One c("RKC", "BKC", "TANNER", "SNOW", "HYBRID", "HAIR"). region Character string describing region interest. One c("EBS", "NBS"). Defaults "EBS" Eastern Bering Sea. district Character string. One many c("", "BB", "NORTH", "NS", "PRIB", "STMATT", "UNSTRAT", "E166", "W166", "166TO173"). Defaults "" districts within selected region specified. crab_category Character string. One many c("mature_male", "large_male", "legal_male", "preferred_male", "immature_male", "small_male", "sublegal_male", "mature_female", "immature_female", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected categories; "all_categories" provide estimates relevant category given species. using female category, maturity based morphometric maturity (default female_maturity = "morphometric"). Set female_maturity = "cutline" want define female maturity based ADF&G size cutlines. female_maturity Character string. One c("morphometric", "cutline"). Defaults "morphometric" maturity female crab. Morphometric maturity biomass abundance estimates available male crab time.

title: Assign size-sex-maturity categories based on species- and district-specific size definitions — set_crab_category
text: data frame crab specimen data additional "CATEGORY" column stock-specific maturity designations.

what: Helper function to set optional variables and subset data — set_variables
title: Helper function to set optional variables and subset data — set_variables
text: utility function subset specimen data optional specimen biometric categories, set variables use CPUE, abundance, biomass calculations within crabpack::calc_cpue() crabpack::calc_bioabund() functions.

title: Helper function to set optional variables and subset data — set_variables
code: set_variables(   crab_data = NULL,   species = NULL,   sex = NULL,   size_min = NULL,   size_max = NULL,   crab_category = NULL,   female_maturity = c("morphometric", "cutline")[1],   shell_condition = NULL,   egg_condition = NULL,   clutch_size = NULL,   bin_1mm = FALSE )

title: Helper function to set optional variables and subset data — set_variables
text: crab_data Object created crabpack::get_specimen_data(). species Character string. One c("RKC", "BKC", "TANNER", "SNOW", "HYBRID", "HAIR"). sex Character string. One c("male", "female"). Optional, "male" "female" provide estimates selected sex, specifying "male" "female" provide estimates selected sexes. size_min Integer. Optional, desired lower range crab size (inclusive). size_max Integer. Optional, desired upper range crab size (inclusive). crab_category Character string. One many c("mature_male", "large_male", "legal_male", "preferred_male", "immature_male", "small_male", "sublegal_male", "mature_female", "immature_female", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected categories; "all_categories" provide estimates relevant category given species. using female category, maturity based morphometric maturity (default female_maturity = "morphometric"). Set female_maturity = "cutline" want define female maturity based ADF&G size cutlines. See crabpack::set_crab_category() documentation description species-specific category combinations. female_maturity Character string. One c("morphometric", "cutline"). Defaults "morphometric" maturity female crab. Morphometric maturity biomass abundance estimates available male crab time. shell_condition Character string. One many c("soft_molting", "new_hardshell", "oldshell", "very_oldshell", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected shell conditions; "all_categories" provide estimates available shell condition category. egg_condition Character string. One many c("none", "uneyed", "eyed", "dead", "empty_cases", "hatching", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected egg conditions; "all_categories" provide estimates available egg condition category. Note specifying egg_condition return female specimens final output. clutch_size Character string. One many c("immature", "mature_barren", "trace", "quarter", "half", "three_quarter", "full", "all_categories"). Optional, specifying parameter provide estimates selected clutch sizes; "all_categories" provide estimates available clutch size category. Note specifying clutch_size return female specimens final output. bin_1mm Boolean T/F. TRUE, estimates provided 1mm bin within size range specified size_min /size_max, full range observed sizes data. Defaults FALSE.

title: Helper function to set optional variables and subset data — set_variables
text: named list subsetted specimen data biometrics interest well variables carried forward CPUE, abundance, biomass calculations across selected biometrics.
